intro: Scytalia benghalensis, commonly known as the Bengal scytalia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of milky sap. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
